refnamediv.refpurpose: Generates an error if the variable has not the required size.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: errmsg = fminimaxCheckdims ( funname , var , varname , ivar , matdims )

listitem.para: a 1 x 1 matrix of strings, the name of the calling function.
a 1 x 1 matrix of valid Scilab data type, the variable
a 1 x 1 matrix of string, the name of the variable
a 1 x 1 matrix of floating point integers, the index of the input argument in the calling sequence
1 x 2 matrix of floating point integers, the number of rows, columns for the variable #ivar
a 1 x 1 matrix of strings, the error message. If there was no error, the error message is the empty matrix.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function is designed to be used to design functions where the input argument has a known shape. This function cannot be use when var is a function, or more generally, for any input argument for which the size function does not work. Last update : 05/08/2010.
